wikipedia_page.main: Henry Stuart (1885–1942) was a British-Swiss film actor known for his work in Germany. Stuart was born in Cairo, but educated in Britain. He attended the Academy of Fine Arts in Munich, intending to become a painter. After moving into the German film industry following the First World War, Stuart played a number of prominent supporting roles in productions such as Joyless Street (1925). Stuart's film career largely ended with the arrival of sound, and he worked increasingly on the stage. His final film appearance was a small role in the Nazi agfacolor epic Münchhausen (1943), released after his death.

response: Henry Stuart may refer to:
* Henry Stuart, Lord Darnley (1545–1567), King Consort of Scotland, cousin and second husband of Mary, Queen of Scots, father of James VI of Scotland
* Henry Stuart, Duke of Gloucester (1640–1660), Protestant younger brother of Charles II and James II of England
* Henry Stuart (MP) (1804–1854), English MP for Bedford
* Henry Stuart (priest) (1864–1933), Anglican Dean of Carlisle
* Henry Stuart (actor) (1885–1942), British-Swiss film actor
* Henry Stuart (Australian politician) (1853–1910), New South Wales politician
*Henry Stuart as Egon Stirner
*Henry Stuart

Die Zwei und die Dame (German: Two and a Lady) is a 1926 German silent comedy crime film directed by Alwin Neuß and starring Agnes Esterhazy, Bernhard Goetzke and Henry Stuart. It was based on a novel by Sven Elvestad. It premiered in Berlin on 12 March 1926.Grange p.220
* Henry Stuart as Polizeileutnant Helmersen

link_mentions.page: The Woman with the World Record
response: The Woman with the World Record () is a 1927 German silent film directed by Erich Waschneck and starring Joop van Hulzen, Lee Parry and Henry Stuart.Grange p. 266
* Henry Stuart as Will Carry, a sports patron
* Henry Stuart as Kriminalkommissar Dengern

Scandal in Baden-Baden (German: Skandal in Baden-Baden) is a 1929 German silent film directed by Erich Waschneck and starring Brigitte Helm, Ernst Stahl-Nachbaur and Henry Stuart.Bock & Bergfelder p.33
* Henry Stuart as Baron Egon von Halden
* Henry Stuart as Edward, der Sohn von P.L. Harland
* Henry Stuart as Commander Norton
The Street of Forgetting (German:Die Straße des Vergessens) is a 1926 German silent film directed by Heinz Paul and starring Hella Moja, Henry Stuart and Ida Wüst.Nelmes & Selbo
* Henry Stuart as Juan Alvaro, Kapitän der spanischen Armee
* Henry Stuart as Kaiser Franz

The Beggar from Cologne Cathedral () is a 1927 German silent crime film directed by Rolf Randolf and starring Henry Stuart, Elza Temary and Carl de Vogt.Stach & Morsbach p. 145 A detective on the trail of a gang of criminals traces them to Cologne.
Give Me Life (German: Schenk mir das Leben) is a 1928 German silent drama film directed by Klaus Fery and starring Grete Reinwald, Henry Stuart and Elizza La Porta.Lamprecht p.195
* Henry Stuart

Derby (German: Derby. Ein Ausschnitt aus der Welt des Trabersports) is a 1926 German silent film directed by  Max Reichmann and starring Barbara von Annenkoff, Henry Stuart and Grete Mosheim.Bock & Lenssen p.177
* Henry Stuart as Baron von Reiffenberg

The Man in the Fire (German: Der Mann im Feuer) is a 1926 German silent film directed by Erich Waschneck and starring Helga Thomas, Olga Tschechowa and Henry Stuart.Bock & Bergfelder p.485 It was released in the United States under the alternative title of When Duty Calls.
* Henry Stuart as Hellmuth Frank

The Girl Without a Homeland () is a 1927 Austrian-German silent drama film directed by Constantin J. David and starring Jenny Hasselqvist, Henry Stuart, and Oskar Homolka.
The Wig (German: Die Perücke) is a 1925 German silent comedy film directed by Berthold Viertel and starring Otto Gebühr, Jenny Hasselqvist and Henry Stuart.Grange p.190
* Henry Stuart as Julian
Flirtation (German: Liebelei) is a 1927 German silent drama film directed by Jacob Fleck and Luise Fleck and starring Fred Louis Lerch, Henry Stuart and Jaro Fürth.Krautz p.170
* Henry Stuart as Theodor Kaiser, sein Studienfreund
* Henry Stuart as Hans v. Romberg
